discoveries.purpose: Root travel planner project with multi-agent orchestration system
organization_rules: Root contains project documentation (README.md)
Repository has specific folder structure: .claude/, config/, data/, docs/, output/, repo/, schemas/, scripts/
Trip-specific folders created at root level with kebab-case naming
Repository deployed as GitHub Pages at https://Yugoge.github.io/travel-planner-graph/

discoveries.purpose: Claude Code configuration with MCP skills, agents, and commands
organization_rules: Contains 8 specialized travel planning agents (accommodation, attractions, budget, entertainment, meals, shopping, timeline, transportation)
Contains 7 MCP skills (Airbnb, Duffel Flights, Gaode Maps, Google Maps, OpenMeteo Weather, RedNote, shared utilities)
Contains 3 slash commands (plan, gaode-maps, test-gaode)
settings.json manages global configuration (NOT committed with API keys)
Skills follow progressive disclosure pattern (no context pollution)
Each skill is self-contained with scripts/, tools/, examples/ subdirectories

discoveries.purpose: MCP skill integrations for external APIs and services
organization_rules: Each skill is self-contained in its own directory
Standard skill structure: skill.md (prompt), scripts/ (implementations), tools/ (MCP tools), examples/ (usage examples)
7 skills: airbnb, duffel-flights, gaode-maps, google-maps, openmeteo-weather, rednote, shared
Skills use script-based execution (no context pollution)
API keys managed via environment variables
Shared skill contains common utilities for other skills
8 single-responsibility agents for travel planning domains
Agent files: accommodation.md, attractions.md, budget.md, entertainment.md, meals.md, shopping.md, timeline.md, transportation.md
Agents receive structured JSON context and return structured JSON output
Agents do NOT orchestrate other agents (orchestration handled by /plan command)
Agents use skills/ for external data fetching
Agents write output to data/ directory
discoveries.action_taken: skip (agents are .md prompts, documented in .claude/ readme)

discoveries.purpose: User-facing slash commands that orchestrate agents
organization_rules: 3 commands: plan.md (main orchestrator), gaode-maps.md (China routing), test-gaode.md (testing)
Commands orchestrate agents and build comprehensive context
Commands handle user interaction and results presentation
Commands delegate implementation to agents
Commands can have subdirectories for resources (e.g., gaode-maps/)
discoveries.action_taken: skip (commands are .md prompts, documented in .claude/ readme)

discoveries.purpose: Configuration templates for MCP servers and project settings
organization_rules: Contains template configuration files (NOT user secrets)
Files: currency-config.json, fallback-images.json, mcp-config-template.json
Templates serve as starting points for user customization
User copies templates and adds their own API keys
NO API keys committed to git (use environment variables)

discoveries.purpose: Travel plan data storage in structured JSON format
organization_rules: Each trip has its own subdirectory with timestamped naming
Standard trip structure: requirements-skeleton.json, plan-skeleton.json, timeline.json, {category}.json
Required files: requirements-skeleton.json, plan-skeleton.json, timeline.json
Optional files: transportation.json, accommodation.json, attractions.json, meals.json, entertainment.json, shopping.json, budget.json
Trip directory naming: {destination}-{dates}-{timestamp}
3 active trip directories: beijing-exchange-bucket-list-20260202-232405, china-exchange-bucket-list-2026, china-feb-15-mar-7-2026-20260202-195429
Workflow subdirectories: clean/, dev/, test/, archive/, guides/, reference/, reports/
clean/ stores cleanup workflow JSONs
dev/ stores development workflow JSONs
test/ stores test workflow JSONs
archive/ stores old workflows by month
guides/ stores user guides
reference/ stores reference documentation
reports/ stores generated reports by month
Workflow JSONs are temporary and may be archived after completion
File naming: {type}-{request-id}.json or {type}-{request-id}.md

discoveries.purpose: Final deployment directory for generated HTML travel plans
organization_rules: Root-level HTML files are latest versions (overwritten on each deployment)
travel-plan-data/ subdirectory contains timestamped versions (backup)
HTML naming: travel-plan-{destination-slug}-{timestamp}.html
Generated by scripts/generate-html-interactive.py
Features: bilingual toggle, collapsible sections, POI cards, embedded maps
Deployed to GitHub Pages for web hosting
Contains gh-pages branch content for GitHub Pages
Trip-specific subdirectories mirror project structure
index.html provides navigation to all travel plans
node_modules/ for deployment dependencies
output/ for staging HTML files
Deployed travel plans: beijing-exchange-bucket-list, china-exchange-bucket-list, china-feb-15-mar-7-2026

discoveries.purpose: JSON schema definitions for travel plan data validation
organization_rules: Domain schemas: accommodation.schema.json, attractions.schema.json, budget.schema.json, entertainment.schema.json, meals.schema.json, shopping.schema.json, timeline.schema.json, transportation.schema.json
Common schema: poi-common.schema.json (shared POI fields)
Documentation: poi-data-schema.md, naming-convention.md
Schemas enforce data consistency across agents and scripts
Used by validation scripts to check data quality

discoveries.purpose: Helper scripts for travel plan validation, generation, and deployment
organization_rules: Validation scripts: check-*.sh, validate-*.sh
Generation scripts: generate-*.sh, generate-*.py
Deployment scripts: deploy-*.sh
Workflow scripts: todo/ directory for TodoWrite integration
Subdirectories: gaode-maps/, lib/, todo/, utils/, archive/
lib/html_generator.py: Class-based HTML generator module
All scripts parameterized (no hardcoded paths)
Scripts return proper exit codes (0=success, 1=failure, 2=invalid args)

discoveries.purpose: China exchange trip bucket list planning
organization_rules: Timestamped subdirectories: 2026-02-10/
Contains trip data JSON files
Bucket list format (not itinerary-based)
Follows standard trip structure with category breakdowns

Contains trip data JSON files
Bucket list format (not itinerary-based)

Timestamped subdirectories: 2026-02-02/, 2026-02-10/, 2026-02-11/

Contains comprehensive trip data with all categories
Itinerary-based format (day-by-day schedule)
Active development (most recent commits)
